english: to examine; to test; to take an exam; to check

etymology.description: Ideogrammic: 耂 “old man, bent over” + 丂 “walking cane” (originally drawn as 匕); an elder leaning on a cane. Structurally related to 老; often cited as 轉注 (“reciprocal meaning”) with 老.
etymology.interpretation: An elder leaning on a cane evokes age and authority, those who could judge, verify, or question others. From consulting or being tested by elders came the senses to examine, to test, and to check; in classical usage it also extended to meanings related to one’s (deceased) father.

examples.chinese: 我明天要考试(我明天要考試)。
examples.english: I'm going to take an exam tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 他正在考驾照(他正在考駕照)。
examples.english: He is taking the driving test.

examples.chinese: 请你仔细考证这段历史(請你仔細考證這段歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ zǐxì kǎozhèng zhè duàn lìshǐ.
examples.english: Please carefully verify this period of history.
